item.title: Nancy_dancehall add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nancy_dancehall add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Nancy_dancehall add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You can safely assume you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Nancy_dancehall add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "And she is going to dance, dance hungry, dance full, dance each cold astonishing moment, now when she is young and again when she is old." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Nancy_dancehall add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "There is no exquisite beautyâ€¦ without some strangeness in the proportion." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Nancy_dancehall add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury
